{"step_by_step_thinking": "According to the relevant documents, the sphenoidal sinuses are supplied by branches of the pharyngeal arteries from the maxillary arteries. The innervation of the sphenoidal sinuses is provided by the posterior ethmoidal branch of the ophthalmic nerve [V1], and the maxillary nerve [V2] via orbital branches from the pterygopalatine ganglion. Therefore, the correct answer is the posterior ethmoidal nerve.", "answer_choice": "A"}
